item.title: 墨西哥州长称英伟达将投资 10 亿美元在墨西哥北部建设人工智能数据中心
item.description: 墨西哥北部新莱昂州州长塞缪尔-加西亚（Samuel Garcia）周三表示，英伟达（Nvidia）将投资 10 亿美元在墨西哥北部新莱昂州建立一个所谓的绿色数据中心，重点发展人工智能。【原文：Nvidia will invest $1 billion to build a so-called green data center focusing on artificial intelligence in the northern Mexican state of Nuevo Leon, Governor Samuel Garcia said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 数据显示，10 月份错过汽车贷款还款的次级贷款者人数创历史新高
item.description: 惠誉评级公司（Fitch Ratings）的数据显示，拖欠汽车贷款至少 60 天的次级借款人比例在 10 月份上升到 6.65%，创下历史最高水平。【原文：The share of subprime borrowers at least 60 days behind on their auto loans rose to 6.65% in October, the highest level on record, according to Fitch Ratings data going back to the early 1990s.】

item.title: 美联储沃勒：简化支付账户将于 2026 年第四季度投入使用
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（Fed Reserve）理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周三表示，美联储的目标是在明年第四季度之前启用一套新的简化支付账户，以便根据风险情况使用美联储的支付服务。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve aims to get a new set of streamlined payment accounts that would allow risk-tailored access to Fed payment services operational by the fourth quarter of next year, Fed Governor Christopher Waller said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 尽管航班中断，达美航空本季度业绩依然强劲
item.description: 达美航空公司首席执行官埃德-巴斯蒂安（Ed Bastian）周三向CNBC表示，尽管联邦政府停摆导致航班中断，但达美航空公司预计第四季度业绩仍将强劲。【原文：Delta Air Lines expects to have a strong fourth-quarter despite flight disruptions caused by the federal government shutdown, the carrier's CEO Ed Bastian told CNBC on Wednesday.】

item.title: 华尔街监管机构主席称将考虑加密代币分类
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）负责人周三表示，该机构将很快考虑为数字资产设立一个分类，以帮助确定它们何时可被视为证券。【原文：The head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Wednesday the agency would soon consider establishing a classification for digital assets to help determine when they can be considered securities.】

item.title: 苹果公司称，开发者费用削减不会转嫁给欧盟用户
item.description: iPhone 制造商苹果公司周三表示，苹果公司为遵守欧盟技术法规而降低开发者费用的做法并没有降低用户的价格，苹果公司再次批评了欧洲为控制其市场力量而做出的努力。【原文：Lower developer fees implemented by Apple to comply with European Union tech regulations have not reduced prices for users, the iPhone maker said on Wednesday, renewing its criticism of Europe's efforts to rein in its market power.】

item.title: OpenAI 抗议交出数百万 ChatGPT 对话的命令
item.description: 在《纽约时报》和其他新闻机构提起的版权侵权诉讼中，OpenAI 周三要求纽约联邦法官撤销要求其交出 2000 万条匿名 ChatGPT 聊天记录的命令，称这将暴露用户的私人对话。【原文：OpenAI asked a federal judge in New York on Wednesday to reverse an order that required it to turn over 20 million anonymized ChatGPT chat logs amid a copyright infringement lawsuit by the New York Times and other news outlets, saying it would expose users' private conversations.】

item.title: Waymo 在旧金山、洛杉矶和凤凰城推出机器人出租车高速公路服务
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的 Waymo 公司周三表示，它将开始在旧金山、洛杉矶和菲尼克斯提供使用高速公路的机器人出租车服务，在自动驾驶行业竞争激烈的情况下加紧扩张。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo said on Wednesday it will begin offering robotaxi rides that use freeways across San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Phoenix, as it steps up expansion amid competition in the self-driving industry.】

item.title: 英国大臣推动监管机构加快网络安全执法
item.description: 英国技术大臣利兹-肯德尔（Liz Kendall）周三敦促通信监管机构通信管理局（Ofcom）加快执行旨在保护儿童免受伤害的更严格的网络安全规则，并表示她对延迟执行感到担忧。【原文：British technology minister Liz Kendall urged the communications regulator Ofcom to speed up enforcement of tougher online safety rules designed to protect children from harm, saying on Wednesday that she was concerned about delays.】

item.title: 贝森特表示将逐步调整美国国债拍卖，维护稳定
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周三表示，他预计国债市场将继续保持强劲需求，财政部将逐步调整息票拍卖规模，以避免市场混乱。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Wednesday that he anticipates robust demand continuing in the Treasury debt market and the department will gradually adjust coupon auction sizes to avoid market disruptions.】

item.title: 迪斯尼延长首席财务官约翰斯顿的聘用合同
item.description: 华特-迪士尼（Walt Disney）已将首席财务官休-约翰斯顿（Hugh Johnston）的聘用合同延长约两年，因为这家媒体公司正在对其运营进行全面改革，并重新将重点放在流媒体业务上。【原文：Walt Disney has extended the employment contract of CFO Hugh Johnston by about two years as the media company undertakes a sweeping overhaul of its operations, with a renewed focus on its streaming business.】

item.title: 空中交通缺勤率下降，美国航空公司航班取消率下降
item.description: 就在美国国会众议院将于周三就结束创纪录的政府停摆的法案进行投票表决的几小时前，由于空中交通管制缺勤率下降，美国航班取消率在过去一天大幅下降。【原文：U.S. flight cancellations have fallen sharply over the last day as air traffic control absences have shrunk just hours before the House of Representatives is set to vote on a bill Wednesday to end a record-setting government shutdown.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克表示将于 2026 年 2 月任期届满时退休
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周三表示，他将在 2026 年 2 月 28 日本届任期结束时退休，他是美联储 12 家地区性银行中第一位黑人和第一位公开的同性恋总裁。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic, the first Black and the first openly gay president of one of the Fed's 12 regional banks, said on Wednesday he will retire at the end of his current term on February 28, 2026.】

item.title: 贝森特表示将采取 "实质性 "措施降低美国咖啡和其他产品的价格
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周三表示，美国人将在未来几天看到旨在降低咖啡、香蕉和其他非美国种植产品价格的 "实质性公告"。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Wednesday said Americans would see "substantial announcements" in coming days aimed at lowering the prices of products like coffee, bananas and other items not grown in the U.S.】

item.title: Anthropic 将投资 500 亿美元在美国建设数据中心
item.description: 人工智能初创公司 Anthropic 周三表示，它将投资 500 亿美元在美国建设数据中心，这是该行业最新一笔数十亿美元的投资，因为各公司都在竞相扩大其人工智能基础设施。【原文：AI startup Anthropic said on Wednesday it would invest $50 billion in building data centers in the U.S., the latest multi-billion-dollar outlay in the industry as companies race to expand their artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 金融系统网络攻击激增，巴西央行誓言制定更严格的规则
item.description: 巴西央行监管总监艾尔顿-阿基诺（Ailton Aquino）周三表示，巴西央行正准备推进加强对金融系统的监管，以遏制网络攻击的增加。【原文：Brazil's central bank is preparing to advance tighter regulation of the financial system to curb a rise in cyberattacks, the bank's supervision director, Ailton Aquino, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国加征关税后，印度批准为出口商提供 51 亿美元的一揽子服务
item.description: 印度新闻部长阿什维尼-瓦伊什纳夫（Ashwini Vaishnaw）周三表示，印度内阁已批准斥资4506亿卢比（约合51亿美元）支持出口商，其中包括2000亿卢比的银行贷款信用担保。【原文：India's cabinet has approved spending 450.6 billion rupees ($5.1 billion) on support for exporters, including 200 billion rupees in credit guarantees on bank loans, Information Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田开设美国电池厂，确认高达 100 亿美元的投资计划
item.description: 丰田汽车周三表示，其投资 139 亿美元的北卡罗来纳州电池厂已开始生产，并确认计划五年内在美国投资 100 亿美元。【原文：Toyota Motor on Wednesday said it had begun production at its $13.9 billion North Carolina battery plant and confirmed it plans to invest up to $10 billion over five years in the United States.】

item.title: 制裁阻碍卢克石油公司在罗马尼亚黑海的钻探计划
item.description: 奥斯陆上市公司 Vantage Drilling 取消了明年的钻探合同，两名业内人士周三告诉路透社，该合同是与受制裁的俄罗斯石油巨头卢克石油公司签订的，用于勘探其在罗马尼亚黑海发现的三叉戟天然气。【原文：Oslo-listed Vantage Drilling cancelled a contract to drill next year, which two industry sources told Reuters on Wednesday was with sanctioned Russian oil major Lukoil for exploration at its Romanian Black Sea Trident gas discovery.】

item.title: 报告称，监管明朗后，有收益的加密资产有望增长
item.description: 区块链公司RedStone在周三的一份报告中表示，随着《GENIUS法案》通过后机构采用加密货币的速度加快，加密货币市场的收益资产有望迅速增长。【原文：Yield-bearing assets in the cryptocurrency market are expected to grow rapidly as institutional adoption accelerates after the passage of the GENIUS Act, blockchain firm RedStone said in a report on Wednesday.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯：美联储可能很快开始购买债券以管理市场流动性
item.description: 纽约联储主席约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周三重申，作为维持对短期利率控制的技术性努力的一部分，美国央行不得不重启债券购买的时间越来越近。【原文：New York Federal Reserve President John Williams reiterated on Wednesday the time is getting closer when the U.S. central bank will have to restart bond purchases as part of a technical effort to maintain control over short-term interest rates.】

item.title: Synopsys 将在重大重组中裁员约 10
item.description: 根据周三提交的一份监管文件，Synopsys 将裁员约 10%，即大约 2000 人，因为这家芯片设计软件制造商希望将投资转向增长机会。【原文：Synopsys will lay off about 10% or roughly 2,000 employees, as the chip-design software maker looks to redirect investment towards growth opportunities, according to a regulatory filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: GlobalFoundries 预计本季度汽车和数据中心芯片需求乐观
item.description: 受汽车和数据中心市场客户强劲需求的推动，合约芯片制造商 GlobalFoundries 周三预测第四季度利润和收入将高于华尔街预期。【原文：Contract chipmaker GlobalFoundries forecast fourth-quarter profit and revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by strong demand from its clients in the automotive and data center markets.】

item.title: 银行监管机构称，欧盟现有加密货币规则可应对稳定币风险
item.description: 在欧洲中央银行警告稳定币可能威胁金融稳定之后，欧洲的银行监管机构告诉路透社，欧洲现有的加密货币规则已经包含了防范稳定币风险的措施。【原文：Europe's existing crypto rules already contain safeguards against risks posed by stablecoins, the region's banking supervisor told Reuters, after the European Central Bank warned that the tokens could threaten financial stability.】

item.title: 金-卡戴珊的 Skims 公司以 50 亿美元的估值获得新一轮融资
item.description: 由电视真人秀明星兼企业家金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）和詹斯-格雷德（Jens Grede）共同创立的 Skims 公司周三表示，该公司已筹集到 2.25 亿美元的新资金，使该塑身衣品牌的估值达到 50 亿美元。【原文：Skims, founded by reality TV star and entrepreneur Kim Kardashian along with Jens Grede, said on Wednesday it had raised $225 million in new capital, valuing the shapewear label at $5 billion.】

item.title: 吉尔吉斯斯坦推出 5000 万美元的国家稳定币代币
item.description: 吉尔吉斯斯坦金融监管机构本周表示，该国已发行了价值超过 5000 万美元的国家稳定币 USDKG，该币以黄金为支撑，与美元挂钩。【原文：Kyrgyzstan has launched over $50 million worth of its national stablecoin, USDKG, backed by gold and pegged to the U.S. dollar, the country’s financial regulator said this week.】

item.title: Coinbase 将在得克萨斯州重新成立公司
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Coinbase 在周三提交的一份文件中表示，该公司将在新的商业中心德克萨斯州重新注册成立，并将离开特拉华州。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase is reincorporating in the new business hub of Texas, and is set to leave Delaware, the company said in a filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国财政部长贝森特将在费城造币厂铸造最后一枚便士
item.description: 财政部表示，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）和财政部长布兰登-比奇（Brandon Beach）将于周三访问费城造币厂，监督最终流通的一美分硬币或便士的生产，每枚硬币的生产成本接近 4 美分。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Treasurer Brandon Beach will visit the Philadelphia Mint on Wednesday to oversee production of the final circulating one-cent coin or penny, each of which costs nearly 4 cents to produce, Treasury said.】

item.title: 加拿大 Loblaw 公司上调年度利润预期，原因是杂货需求强劲
item.description: 加拿大零售商 Loblaw 周三上调了其年度利润预期，第三季度利润超过预期，该零售商押注在经济不确定的情况下，其折扣店的杂货和药品需求仍将保持弹性。 该零售商对 Maxi 和 No Frills 等折扣品牌的重视，以及以价值为导向的计划，如保持低价和推出积极的促销活动，帮助吸引了更多有预算意识的加拿大人。【原文：Loblaw raised its annual profit forecast after beating third-quarter profit estimates on Wednesday, as the Canadian retailer bet on demand for grocery and medicines at its discount stores to remain resilient amid economic uncertainties. The retailer's focus on discount banners such as Maxi and No Frills and value-driven programs like keeping prices low and rolling out aggressive promotions has helped attract more budget-conscious Canadians.】

item.title: 欧佩克认为 2026 年石油市场趋于平衡，进一步偏离赤字预测
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）周三发布的一份报告显示，明年世界石油供应有望与需求相匹配，这反映了欧佩克+组织（OPEC+ Group）的增产情况，标志着该组织进一步改变了早先对2026年供应短缺的预测。【原文：World oil supply is expected to match demand next year in a reflection of the wider OPEC+ group's production increases, an OPEC report showed on Wednesday, marking a further shift from its earlier projections of a supply deficit in 2026.】
